title: Ethereum (ETH) Price Prediction: Will ETH Break the $1,800 Barrier Soon as Wall Street Memes Presale Closes ... - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price is currently around $1,584, with a trading volume of $3.6 billion in the last 24 hours. The cryptocurrency is at a pivotal point, with the impending closure of the Wall Street Memes presale tomorrow potentially bringing fresh interest and activity to the crypto sector. ETH faces resistance at $1,600 and support at $1,575, and a breakout from this range could trigger further price movements. The $WSM presale is closing tomorrow and has already seen a collection of $25 million, with the tokens available for purchase at $0.0337. However, it is important to note that crypto is a high-risk asset class and investors could lose all of their capital.

title: Ethereum whales prepare ahead of futures Ethereum ETF approval on October 2 - FXStreet
summary: Ethereum whales are preparing for the approval of a futures ETH ETF on October 2, with increased open interest in ETH options on the CME exchange and growing holdings among whales. On-chain metrics such as supply distribution by balance of addresses and whale transaction metric also suggest accumulation and a potential bullish outcome.

title: Was Vitalik Buterin Really Obsessed With XRP and Ripple? Ethereum Insider Ends Speculation - U.Today
summary: Vitalik Buterin's interest in Ripple and XRP has been a topic of speculation in the blockchain community. Steven Nerayoff, a former Ethereum advisor, has provided clarity on the matter, stating that Buterin expressed a desire to implement smart contracts on the Bitcoin network but faced resistance from developers. Nerayoff also discussed his conversations with Buterin about Ripple, which were based on his encounters with Ripple representatives who were seen as exemplars of effective operational practices in the blockchain industry. Nerayoff recalled an incident from 2015 where questions related to XRP were directed to a specific individual within Ripple at a conference he attended. The debate surrounding Buterin's true interests and intentions remains, with some wondering if his interactions with Ripple were more nuanced than initially thought.
